intro: Guamatela, commonly known as the "Crimson Beauty," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its large, showy flowers. Guamatela thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
